### Claim compensation for damage to your health ###

You can claim compensation if your physical or mental health has been affected by the conditions in your home.

Visit the [Shelter website](https://england.shelter.org.uk/housing_advice/repairs/compensation_for_disrepair_and_poor_conditions) for more information about claiming compensation.

components.html:
### Mental health resources 

If your mental health has been affected speak to your GP or one of the charities listed below for support.

- [Hub of hope](https://hubofhope.co.uk/) directs you to mental health support and resources in your area.

- [Mind](https://www.mind.org.uk/) provides help and support for people experiencing mental health problems.  

- [NHS mental health support](https://www.nhs.uk/mental-health/get-urgent-help-for-mental-health/) gives mental health support information, including where to get urgent help. 

- [Samaritans](https://www.samaritans.org/) 24hr phone line for people to talk through problems of all kinds. Call 116 123.

- [Sane line](http://www.sane.org.uk/what_we_do/support/helpline) SANEline is a national out-of-hours mental health helpline.

heading: Housing disrepair and your health
lede: If your health is being affected by an unresolved housing disrepair problem, you should [contact your local council](/local-council-detail) for help.
